FuncDef:
The trap-threshold es-tca command configures the threshold for triggering and clearing the ES-TCA alarm.
The undo trap-threshold es-tca command restores the thresholds for triggering and clearing the ES-TCA alarm.
By default, the threshold for triggering the ES-TCA alarm is 65 and the threshold for clearing the alarm is 30.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the threshold for triggering the ES-TCA alarm.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 900.

Specifies the threshold for clearing the ES-TCA alarm.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 899.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the number of unauthorized E1 codes surpasses the set thresholds, an ES-TCA alarm is generated. The trap-threshold es-tca configures the threshold for triggering and clearing the ES-TCA alarm.
Precautions
resume-threshold must be less than trigger-threshold; otherwise, the command does not take effect.
